awd_titl_txt: RUI: A Numerical Modeling Study of the Catalina Eddy
awd_abstract_narration: Several times a year, usually in the months from May to                    September, a mesoscale vortex called the "Catalina Eddy" interrupts             the prevailing fair weather patterns of coastal southern California             and imposes a dramatically different wind, cloud and temperature                regime for up to a week at a time including pollutant transport                 patterns that radically depart from the usual.                                       From observational analyses, researchers have identified three             factors that might have a strong influence on the formation of the              eddy.  These are topographic relief, strong northerly airflow and               diurnal surface heating.  Under this Research in Undergraduate                  Institutions award, the Principal investigator will use a numerical             model to simulate the Catalina Eddy for the purpose of better                   understanding of the influence of these three factors.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
